contextId.information: Here Yahweh speaks about himself in the third person. AT: "until I, Yahweh, have sent all the people far away from their land, so that no one is left" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: until Yahweh has sent the people far away, and the solitude of the land is great

contextId.information: Here "Your" refers to the people of Moab. It can be stated in third person to be consistent with the previous verse. AT: "Their high fortress" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
Here "they" refers to the people of Israel. This would include Isaiah. AT: "we looked to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
This refers to the people of Israel. AT: "you call yourselves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
Yahweh speaks of himself in the third person. This can be stated in first person. AT: "this is what I, Yahweh, declare" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])

This still refers to the people of Israel. This can be stated in second person. AT: "you will rejoice over your share ... you will ... your land ... will be yours" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: they will rejoice over their share ... they will ... their land ... will be theirs
